ovdesc.p: This application is used to define the layout of incoming generic accounting interface files, and various parameters defining the processing of overrides and the suspensing of entries. The system will allow an ASCII file, which is either of fixed length, padded fields, or delimited by a specified character, to create accounting entries. The application will ensure that balanced, verified entries are raised in the T24 accounting system.

File Layout The ACSII file may be comprised of record types, which are HEADER or TRAILER records containing control information, and DATA records containing the entry information. Each RECORD.TYPE can be identified by a specified character sequence in the record from a given position (RECORD.ID.POS) for a given length (RECORD.ID.LEN), or the nth element (RECORD.ID.POS) delimited by the delimiter (FIELD.DELIM). The value identifying the specific type may be defined (RECORD.ID) Each element to be extracted within the record will be defined by starting position within the record (DATA.START)and the number of bytes to be extracted (DATA.LEN), or as the nth element (RECORD.ID.POS)with a specified delimiter (FIELD.DELIM). Each data item may have a specified validation routine, either a standard IN2 routine, or a user written validation routine. Data is extracted to a reporting file AC.INWARD.ENTRY, the location of the data to be extracted may be defined in ENQ.FILE.LOC. Accounting Options The generic interface will ensure that entries raised are balanced and verified.

p.p: Entries may be balanced according to the following options:
Balance by currency, debit and credit, ignoring value date.
Balance by currency netting debit and credit entries, irrespective of value date.
Balance by value date and currency, debit and credit.
Balance by value date, currency irrespective of sign, netting debits and credits.

ovdesc.p: Balancing entries may be raised to either a nominated account per currency, or to an internal account of a defined category and department (CONTRA.ACCT.CATEG and ACCOUNT.OFFICER). The balancing (contra) entries will use definable debit and credit transaction codes, together with an additional narrative. In the case of P&L entries, an additional option (CONTRA.PL.LOCAL) allows these entries to be treated as local currency or not when raising balancing entries. If P&L entries are balanced by currency account entries, position updates will result, whereas if treated as local currency there is no currency position. Transaction codes may be supplied in the interface file, or default codes (DT.TXN.CODE & CR.TXN.CODE)will be used for debits and credits. The following options will be available for handling errors and overrides: Overrides may automatically be approved The entry may be automatically suspensed when an override is encountered using the accounting suspense mechanism The entry may be suspensed to an account of specific ACCOUNT.CLASS (SUSP.CLASS.DR/CR) for the currency, and will create a Funds Transfer transaction of HLD status to allow correction of the error automatically defined (FT.TYPE).

desc.p: This field contains the name of the field in DD.ITEM to map the record into, only allowed if the DD.PARAMETER exists.
Validation Rules
Should be an existing field name or number in DD.ITEM. • A maximum of 35 alphanumeric characters may be entered.
Specific currency code used to allow a specific contra account to be defined for the currency. CONTRA.CCY and CONTRA.ACCT form a related multi value set.
Validation Rules
Must be a valid CURRENCY.
The transaction code to be used when posting CREDIT entries from the interface, should no transaction code be supplied.
Validation Rules
Must be the key to a valid record on the TRANSACTION file. Mandatory.

Specifies additional validation routines to be applied to entry created from the interface file. User written routines may be specified to valdiate the contents of the entry. The routine, if written must contain them following arguments: Entry Record (Stmt / Categ entry to be raised) (IN) Reporting Record (AC.INWARD.ENTRY record) (IN) may be modified Error Message (OUT) any error messages preventing posting of the entry Suspense Message (OUT) any error message causing the entry to be suspensed Generally available routine which may be used include: FT.VALIDATE.DD.MANDATE This will validate an entry to see if a direct debit mandate exists for it. It relies on the following information being mapped into local reference of AC.INWARD.ENTRY, and the local reference items having the names specified below: "THEIR.ACCOUNT" - The account number to which the DD is payable. "THEIR.SORT.CODE" - The sort code of the destination account. "PROCESS.DATE" - The Processing date of the mandate. The routine will also use ACCOUNT.NUMBER and THEIR.REFERENCE to check against the Standing Order file. FT.CHECK.AUTO.LIMIT Validates the local currency equivalent of an entry against the AUTO.PROCESS.LIMIT in FT.APPL.DEFAULT. If exceeded the entry is suspensed.
Validation Rules
Optional Input.

The starting position of the element in the record which identifies the record type is defined here in a fixed length file, or the element number of the record id in a delimited file. Fields RECORD.TYPE to ENQ.LOC.FILE form a related multi value set.
Validation Rules
1 to 4 numeric characters. Mandatory.
The narrative to be added to the contra entries raised.
Validation Rules
Mandatory.

Contains the value of the field delimiter character when a delimited file is supplied. The delimiter may be any character and can be expressed as the actual character, or the ASCII value of the character in the format [nnn] where nnn is in the range 1-255. Where no value is defined the file must contain fixed length padded records.
Validation Rules
Value may be a single character. or The ASCII value of a character in the format [nnn] where nnn is the ASCII value.
The field is to specify if the format described is for a direct debit.
Validation Rules
: • It must be the key to valid record on the DD.PARAMETER file. • A maximum of 4 alphanumeric characters may be entered.

Starting position in the record of the associated data item for a fixed length file, and the field number for a delimited file. A delimited file must contain a FIELD.DELIM value. Fields DATA.ITEM to ENQ.FILE.LOC form a related sub value set. Fields RECORD.TYPE to ENQ.LOC.FILE form a related multi value set.
Validation Rules
Mandatory.

This field holds the option to be used for raising balancing entries. The options available are: CURRENCY - Balance by currency, debit and credit, ignoring value date. CURRENCY.NET - Balance by currency, netting debit and credit entries irrespective of value date. CCY.VAL - Balance by value date and currency, debit and credit. CCY.VAL.NET - Balance by value date, currency irrespective of sign, netting debits or credits. ENTRY - Balance each individual entry.
Validation Rules
Must be one of either CURRENCY, CURRENCY.NET, CCY.VAL, CCY.VAL.NET or ENTRY. Mandatory.

Specifies whether the system should update the reporting file AC.INWARD.ENTRY when processing transactions. This file is usually updated to provide a record of the entries contained in the interface file being processed, however in certain circumstances the volume of data received means that this is not required. If this is the case the value of this field should be set to NO. Note that if the value is set to NO the system will not be able to produce any of the audit reports specified in PRODUCE.REPORT field.
Validation Rules
Optional Input Valid entries are YES and No

Holds the SYSTEM.ID to be used in the accounting entries created. The value in this field is used to identify the source application of the entries. The first 2 characters are used to split entries by section in the transaction journal report.
Validation Rules
Must be the key to a valid record on the EB.SYSTEM.ID file. Mandatory.
The name of the item in the record. Any value may be entered in this field, however only specific values will be used to create the resultant entry. These are:
DATA.ITEM.NAME DETAILS ACCOUNT Contains the Account Number for the entry mapped to ACCOUNT.NUMBER
PL.CATEGORY Contains PL.CATEGORY. Either PL.CATEGORY or account number should be supplied.
CURRENCY Currency of the entry. Must match the account if supplied. Default is account currency or Local for P&L entries.
VALUE.DATE VALUE.DATE of entry, optional. The value used in the entry will default from the transaction code of the entry used in the field DEFAULT.VALUE.DATE.
AMOUNT Amount of movement in the currency supplied. This must be present, and unsigned.
AMOUNT.LCY Unsigned local equivalent of amount. Optional.
EXCH.RATE Local to foreign exchange to be used. Optional.
SIGN SIGN of entry AMOUNT.May be +,-, DR, CR. If not supplied the TXN.CODE value will be used.
TXN.CODE TRANSACTION.CODE to be used for posting the entry and deriving the SIGN where SIGN is not supplied.
REVERSAL.MARKER A value to indicate if the entry is a reversal of a previous entry.
THEIR.REF The reference of the entry known to the account holder.
OUR.REF The bank's reference to the transaction.
TRANS.REFERENCE The reference allocated to the transaction.
PRODUCT.CATEGORY The product category for P&L entries
ACCOUNT.OFFICER The account officer for P&L entries
CUSTOMER The CUSTOMER.ID for P&L entries.
DEPARTMENT The DEPARTMENT code for P&L entries.

NARRATIVE Entry narrative. Each time this value is supplied, a new value will be added. EXPOSURE.DATE The exposure date for credit items. When not supplied the value will be defaulted from the EXPOSURE.DATE field of the TRANSACTION.
CONTROL.DATE The control date held in the header/trailer.
CONTROL.TOTAL The number of transactions in the file.
FILE.REF The Tape/File number from the header.
CHECKSUM The supplied CHECKSUM from the header.
CALC.CHECKSUM The calculated CHECKSUM in the header.
CR.TOTAL The supplied Credit Txn total in the header.
DR.TOTAL The supplied Debit Txn total in the header.
CALC.CR.TOTAL The Calculated Credit Txn total in header.
CALC.DR.TOTAL The calculated Debit Txn total in header.
EXPIRY.DATE The file expiry date from the header,

LOCAL.REF-NAME where NAME corresponds to a local reference field name defined on the STANDARD.SELECTION table for STMT.ENTRY or CATEG.ENTRY (Multi-valued Local Reference field values should be separated by the character in the input)
Fields DATA.ITEM to ENQ.FILE.LOC form a related sub value set.
Fields RECORD.TYPE to ENQ.LOC.FILE form a related multi value set.
Validation Rules
Up to 30 alphanumeric characters. Mandatory.

A value of "Y" in this field denotes that the associated DATA.ITEM is mandatory. Fields DATA.ITEM to ENQ.FILE.LOC form a related sub value set. Fields RECORD.TYPE to ENQ.LOC.FILE form a related multi value set.
Validation Rules
Where present, input must be Y. Optional.

The key to the ACCOUNT.CLASS record containing the ACCOUNT record with the category to be used when raising suspense entries for non-existent accounts, or accounts with overrides, where the orignal entry was a credit entry. User defined ACCOUNT.CLASS records may be defined with a prefix of U-.
Validation Rules
Must be the key to a valid record on the ACCOUNT.CLASS file. Mandatory.

The length of the associated DATA.ITEM when extracting from the record for a fixed length file. For delimited files this can be used as maximum field length check. Fields DATA.ITEM to ENQ.FILE.LOC form a related sub value set. Fields RECORD.TYPE to ENQ.LOC.FILE form a related multi value set.
Validation Rules
1 to 3 numeric characters. Optional for delimited files, mandatory for fixed length files.
Description of the record.
Validation Rules
Mandatory.
The key to the records on this file.
Validation Rules
1 to 10 alphanumeric characters.
The transaction code to be used when posting a debit balancing entry.
Validation Rules
Must be the key to a valid record on the TRANSACTION file. Mandatory.
Description: This field contains the name of the DD.DDI location, allowed if the linked DD.PARAMETER exists.
Validation Rules
Should be an existing field name or number in DD.DDI. • A maximum of 35 alphanumeric characters may be entered.

This field is used to hold the FT.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION which will be used when Funds Transfer records are to be produced in HLD status. When an entry is posted to a suspense account, for example when a non-existent account or P&L category is supplied, or an override is generated from the accounting sub-system, a Funds Transfer record will be created in HLD status, posting the amount to the original account, the other side being the suspense account. If this field is blank, the Funds Transfer records are not produced.
Validation Rules

NOINPUT when the FUNDS.TRANSFER application is not installed, otherwise input must be the key to a valid record on the FT.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION file. Where input, the first two characters must be "AC". Optional.

The name of the ENQUIRY.REPORT record to be used to generate the interface report is specified in this field. The enquiry used to produce the report will normally be based on the AC.INWARD.ENTRY file (although this does not have to be the case). In order to ensure only entries for the file last processed are reported, when the selection field FILE.NAME.NO is used, the selection will be supplied with the file name last updated automatically.
Validation Rules
Must be the key to a valid record on the ENQUIRY.REPORT file. Optional.

This field is used to specify the location in the extract entry file, AC.INWARD.ENTRY, for the associated DATA.ITEM to be mapped to. When the interface file is processed a reporting entry is built in the file AC.INWARD.ENTRY.

The key to this file is: FILE.NAME "." FILE.SEQ.NO "-" record in file (DATA items) FILE.NAME "." FILE.SEQ.NO "-HEADn" (header items) FILE.NAME "." FILE.SEQ.NO "-TRAIL" (trailer) FILE.NAME "." FILE.SEQ.NO "-ERROR" (header/trailer errors)

Data will be mapped to the same field as the corresponding accounting entry to be raised, and additionally to the location defined in this field. Data is always mapped to the reporting file, even if the entry is not raised, the field ENTRY.POSTED denoted whether or not the entry was raised. To define specific multi values and subvalues a "-" character should be specified and the multi/sub value set, e.g. FIELD.NAME-1 FIELD.NAME-1-1 N.B. If the field name specified is LOCAL.REF then the multi value indicator must be present, and a subvalue indicator may be set if required. Fields DATA.ITEM to ENQ.FILE.LOC form a related sub value set. Fields RECORD.TYPE to ENQ.LOC.FILE form a related multi value set.
Validation Rules
Must be a valid data field as defined for the AC.INWARD.ENTRY file.

The transaction code to be used when posting DEBIT entries from the interface, should no transaction code be supplied. If processing a cheque file and the cheque reference number is required to be checked against the PAYMENT.STOP file, the value of CHEQUE.IND should be set to Y in the TRANSACTION record. In this case THEIR.REFERENCE will be checked against PAYMENT.STOP for the account.
Validation Rules
Must be the key to a valid record on the TRANSACTION file. Mandatory.

Specifies whether Profit and Loss entries in foreign currency are treated as local when maintaining a balanced system. If Y is entered any P&L entry will be balanced by a LOCAL currency internal account entry. As a result of this P&L entries will not generate a currency position. If Y is not entered, the balancing entries will be raised in the currency of the entry, which will result in a currency position update.
Validation Rules
Where present, input must be Y. Optional.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.

The name of the validation routine to be applied to the extracted data item. The routine may be a Standard system validation routine beginning IN2..., see Regional Development guide for futher details, or a user customised routine. A user routine must have no arguments, the value is supplied in the variable COMI, and the value may be modified as required, errors should be returned in the variable ETEXT. Some of the main IN2 routines likely to be used are: IN2 Validates numbers, removes leading zeros. IN2ANT Validates internal and customer accounts. Will convert MNEMONIC and ALTERNATE.ACCOUNT ids to account number where valid. IN2ACC As IN2ANT except that only customer accounts are allowed. IN2CUS Validates customer numbers, converts mnemonics to valid numbers where supplied. IN2CCY Validates currency codes. Will convert numeric currency code to a standard code. IN2A Ensures input is alpha-numeric. IN2S Ensures input is SWIFT standard. User Routines which may be used which are generally available include: FT.LOCAL.TXN This will compare an external transaction code supplied against the file FT.LOCAL.TXN.CODES. This may be translated into a Globus transaction code, and may also be used to ignore certain types of transaction. FT.CHECK.SORT.CODE This routine validates the SORT.CODE supplied against the FT.LOCAL.CLEARING record, to see if the code is defined as one of our clearing codes. If not not an error is returned. Fields DATA.ITEM to ENQ.FILE.LOC form a related sub value set. Fields RECORD.TYPE to ENQ.LOC.FILE form a related multi value set.
Validation Rules
Any routines specified in this field must be catalogued. Optional.

Each line of the source file is treated as a separate record, which may be of three basic types: HEADn - Up to nine header records may be defined which contain control information. DATA - The data records are used to create the accounting entries. TRAIL - One trailer record may be defined which may contain control information. Fields RECORD.TYPE to ENQ.LOC.FILE form a related multi value set.
Validation Rules
Input must either be TRAIL, DATA or HEAD followed by 1 digit. Duplicates are not permitted. DATA must be defined. Mandatory.

The length of the record indentifier is defined in this field. For fixed length records this field must be defined, for delimited files this can be used as an optinal maximum length. Fields RECORD.TYPE to ENQ.LOC.FILE form a related multi value set.
Validation Rules
1 to 4 numeric characters Mandatory for fixed length files. Optional for delimited files

The key to the ACCOUNT.CLASS record containing the ACCOUNT record with the category to be used when raising suspense entries for non-existent accounts, or accounts with overrides, where the orignal entry was a debit entry. User defined account class records may be defined with a prefix of U-.
Validation Rules
Must be the key to a valid record on the ACCOUNT.CLASS file. Mandatory.
The transaction code to be used when posting a credit balancing entry.
Validation Rules
Must be the key to a valid record on the TRANSACTION file. Mandatory.
The DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER code to be used in the generation of the default suspense contra account number, and as the ACCOUNT.OFFICER in the contra entry.
Validation Rules
Must be the key to a valid record on the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER file. Mandatory.

This field is used to specify the accounting mode to be used when raising the interface entries, concerning the handling of any overrides which may be raised. The following options are valid: SAO - Automatic override approval. SSS - Suspense entry on override (this option may only be used during EOD). SNP - Do not raise entry on override. If an override is encountered, or a non-existent account number is supplied, the relevant SUSP.CLASS.DR/CR will only be used is the option SNP is used. Option SSS is therfore not recommended.
Validation Rules
Must be one of either SAO, SSS or SNP. Mandatory.
The category code to be used when constructing the balancing suspense account number.
Validation Rules
Must be the key to a valid record on the CATEGORY file, in the range 10000 to 19999. Mandatory input. A record must exist in CATEG.INT.ACCT for the category entered.
The account number in the associated CONTRA.CCY, to be used as the contra account for entries in that currency.
Validation Rules
Must be the key to a valid record on the ACCOUNT file. The currency of the account specified must be that of the currency specified in the related CONTR.CCY field.

The value of the RECORD.ID which indicates that the record is of the type defined. A pattern may be defined for matching, e.g. "2N" will match any two digits. Fields RECORD.TYPE to ENQ.LOC.FILE form a related multi value set.
Validation Rules
Up to 20 characters of any type may be entered. Mandatory.
